text: "Why would the president fire a federal prosecutor just five months before an election, with no indication of wrongdoing on the prosecutorâ€™s part, in a manner sure to ignite controversy?" @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes write: https://t.co/n0KBmssHI4

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"I do not believe that a day has gone by since I came home, more than two months ago, that my mom has not cried."

In this weekâ€™s Dear Therapist, @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader whose momâ€™s mental health struggles have worsened due to the pandemic. https://t.co/6pnUbrOIb4

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We have a chance today to reimagine an old model that has fallen far behind the times. If we do it right, we might even usher in a new golden age of education," Michael D. Smith writes: https://t.co/fuF0bhnFF2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Ricardo Sanchez, the former commander of U.S. ground forces in Iraq, has a lot to say about the "overtly racist comments and discriminatory actions of our current president." David Freed reports: https://t.co/T1PGW0R3Re

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Sociopolitics drew the usage of the word racism beyond the dictionary definition long ago, and it is high time our dictionaries got the message," @JohnHMcWhorter writes: https://t.co/yvcRV0tZbN

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Just as the arc of history bends, so too do human lives, particularly for the millions of young people expecting to launch into new careersâ€”and adulthoodâ€”this spring and summer." @shadihamid writes: https://t.co/ySjjO47o2G

text: The coronavirus outbreak has emboldened defenders of the nation-state, in Europe and beyond, @RachelDonadio writes: https://t.co/VLTzH3Oel5

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @anneapplebaum: "The Trump White House sounds, in [John] Boltonâ€™s telling, like a collection of soulless incompetents, perhaps graced by the presence of an exceedingly rare competent such as Bolton himself (also soulless)." @gcaw reviews Bolton's memoir: https://t.co/IvjV56NZEV

name: TheAtlantic
text: In August 1870, Emily Dickinson was nearly 40 and more comfortable in her skin than in previous years. @MarthaAckmann writes about a rare, face-to-face encounter that revealed a different side to the reclusive poet: https://t.co/1Qt1EYad5Y

name: TheAtlantic
text: The "bronies," adult fans of the children's TV show "My Little Pony," have tacitly allowed white supremacists into their ranks for years. But following Black Lives Matter protests, they're finally waking up, @kait_tiffany reports: https://t.co/puHBSJ5Q74

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The scale of Americaâ€™s carceral system requires weakening constitutional protections in order to function. The resulting direct costs and collateral disadvantages are experienced almost entirely by communities of color," @TahirDuckett writes: https://t.co/vB9YQmpuAl

name: TheAtlantic
text: "At this fraught moment, no one knows enough about consumer sentiment and government ordinances and business failures and stimulus packages and the spread of the disease to make solid predictions about the future," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/bKBv6GVgLk

text: Domestic abuse victims are worried that virtual visitations could give their abusers an intimate glimpse of their homes and even allow them to identify their locations, @AdminKlein writes: https://t.co/ZnkFGW7JKx

name: TheAtlantic
text: Many people may want to shield their kids from the news right now, but research shows that children do better when their parents are honest about tragedy, @katejulian writes: https://t.co/hEkjef1WHk

name: TheAtlantic
text: "[DACA recipients] are frequently portrayed as one of two things: disposable lawbreakers or precocious savants. What gets lost is the immense variety of backgrounds, beliefs, and attitudes represented in a group of 700,000 Americans," @JinNotJim writes: https://t.co/dcKcwo4eci

name: TheAtlantic
text: "A president who aspired, with the help of an ideological attorney general, to exercise authoritarian power over his government is stumbling into blunders that are destroying any illusion of control," George Packer writes: https://t.co/wT7vwe12gS
